value.title: Architect solutions for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt:
A Solution Architect is responsible for the successful design, implementation, deployment, and adoption of an overall solution. A Solution Architect ensures that the solution meets the customer’s needs now and in the future. While the Solution Architect may not “click the buttons” during a deployment, they are ultimately responsible for the solution and work closely with the deployment team.
This learning path covers the pre-sales and analysis phases of a project to include:

What it takes to become a Solution Architect.
Discovering customer needs.
Proposing a solution.
Working with requirements.
Performing fit-gap analysis.

Instructor-led training (ILT) is scheduled for March 2020 that provides more hands-on activities and both this path and ILT are needed for the exam.

topItems.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

topItems.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

topItems.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

topItems.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Microsoft Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer’s needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

value.title: Empower modern analytics and business intelligence data cultures with Excel, Power BI, MS Teams, and SharePoint
value.excerpt: Excel is a Microsoft application that has been in use since 1985. You might be surprised that in addition to simple spreadsheets, Excel can enable modern analytics and business intelligence. In this Learning Path, you will learn how to modernize and empower data conversations within your organization using Excel & Power BI together with MS Teams, and SharePoint. You’ll gain awareness of the business intelligence landscape, technology capabilities, and their roles.

topItems.title: Introduction to modern analytics using Excel and Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces the Microsoft modern analytics core suite of tools, including Office 365/Excel 2016+, Power Query, Data Model, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI service. By using modern analytics technologies, you and your organization can work faster, more efficiently, and smarter by using Excel together with Power BI.

topItems.title: Automate data cleaning with Power Query
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces Power Query in Microsoft Excel, a powerful data connection, cleaning, and shaping technology that is a core part of the Microsoft modern analytics suite of business intelligence tools.

topItems.title: Introduction to foundations in data modeling
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces the key concepts that are related to developing a well-organized data model.

topItems.title: Transition from Excel to Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Microsoft's Power BI combines the Power Query's extraction, transformation, and loading capabilities with DAX and a relational data model in a new application with new features.

value.title: Explore fundamentals of data visualization
value.excerpt: Learn the fundamental principles of analytical data modeling and data visualization, using Microsoft Power BI as a platform to explore these principles in action.

value.title: Model data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Connect Power BI to multiple data sources to create reports. Define the relationship between your data sources.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values.  In order to relate these two tables to one another, what we need is a third table with all distinct values from both tables. In this tutorial

value.title: Create a custom KPI Card in a Power BI report
value.excerpt: Do you want a customized KPI Card in Power BI? Patrick looks at how you could get a custom KPI Card in a Power BI report without using custom visuals.  KPI Card demo files - https://guyinacu.be/kpicardfiles  Guy in a Cube Demos: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Create a Popup Window in Power BI
value.excerpt: Wondering how Patrick created a popup video in a previous video? Well, here you go! Learn how you can create a popup experience to provide more information in your Power BI report.  Bookmarks Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv2BtOtLblH1IJqcqSuMTyvEi7W-laWti  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Drilling into drillthrough in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can use the drillthrough feature within Power BI Desktop. He also looks at how you can drill to multiple fields at the same time. The back image can also be changed and Patrick shows you how to do it!  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com --

value.title: How to create and use a Power BI Hierarchy
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how to create and use a Power BI Hierarchy within Power BI Desktop. Hierarchies can help to provide correct data usage within your Power BI reports.  Sample Download: https://guyinacu.be/hierarchysample  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: NEXT LEVEL Conditional Drill in Power BI Desktop with buttons
value.excerpt: Learn how you can take conditional drill to the NEXT LEVEL in Power BI Desktop with buttons. Patrick also shows how you can add in dynamic page navigation as well. value.title: Power BI Apps vs App Workspace (the new Viewer role)
value.excerpt: The viewer role for Power BI App Workspaces is now available! Now, let's look at Power BI Apps vs. App Workspaces and have a discussion around which is the better way to go for content distribution in your enterprise.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Power BI on a Mac?
value.excerpt: Want to run Power BI on a mac? We look at what your options are to get Power BI Desktop running on your mac. You have a few choices.  Ideas: Power BI Designer for Mac https://ideas.powerbi.com/forums/265200-power-bi-ideas/suggestions/7546645-power-bi-designer-for-mac   Apple Boot Camp https://support.apple.com/boot-camp

value.title: REDUCE the # of measures with Calculation Groups In Power BI
value.excerpt: Sometimes you end up with a LOT of measures that are related. You can reduce the number of measures with Calculation Groups in Power BI and clean up your field list!
